name: Jon Stewart
monologue: I don’t want to be a nitpicker, but I do not remember the assassination episode of Schoolhouse Rock .

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: I believe it was Thomas Jefferson who once said, ‘Our liberty depends on of the freedom of the press—though obviously, as with any right, there is some wiggle room for non-consensual ass-f**king.'

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: What the f**k are we doing? You know I’m pretty sure that shooting a guy on suspicion of stealing a pair of khakis violates not only the Constitution but the Ten Commandments and also the Gap employee handbook.

name: Jon Stewart
monologue: Biden’s back, baby! I know that all the haters have been out there, talking their s**t. ‘He’s too old! He’s too weak! He won’t make it! He won’t be able to stand!’ I see you haters, I know who you are!

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: According to [former Trump Chief of Staff] John Kelly, in private, Trump—how can I put this delicately?—loves Hitler. In fact, Trump told Kelly, ‘Well, Hitler did some good things.’ And the category is, ‘Phrases that should end your candidacy and/or birthday party.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Kelly bravely asked Trump which good things Hitler did, and Trump responded, “Well, he rebuilt the economy… and that’s the end of his story as far as I know.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: That’s called a dictatorship, sir. In a democracy, it can be hard to put even a guilty guy in jail. For instance, uh, what’s his name?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: So it turns out the Nazis had a bit of a dark side?

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: It’s a good thing he held onto that card, ’cause we might have seen his Maestro , if you know what I’m sayin’. His Poor Thing , if you catch my drift. His, uh, his Oppen -penis.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Wow, you really wanna go there? First of all Biden didn’t stutter like that. Second, if you want to make this a word-talkin’ contest, you are one of the weirdest speakers in human history.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: We only have two candidates left, and they have starkly different messages. Biden’s message is, ‘Vote for me because Trump is terrible.’ Trump’s message is, ‘Vote for me because I am terrible.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Yesterday, the U.K. celebrated Mother’s Day. Or as they call it, ‘Bangers and Mum.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: You think Facebook is the enemy of the people? Dude, have you ever been on Facebook? Everyone’s uncle is on there and they love you.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: So you talked to a bunch of doctors who told you all the symptoms of dementia. Are you sure they weren’t your doctors? I would say the first sign of dementia is going in for a doctor’s appointment and thinking you’re the one interviewing the doctor.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: When the Biden team heard [Sean] Hannity say the phrase ‘Jacked Up Joe’ that many times, I bet they said, ‘Thank you for the kick-ass new nickname.’

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Now, we can’t legally say that Trump is on drugs, but he does look like every side effect from a drug commercial. Sweats like crazy, gets cotton mouth, has trouble seeing the teleprompter, and glitches like his brain is an exploding Rube Goldberg machine.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Nobody’s ever needed to say ‘I’m not a doctor’ less than Jesse Watters.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: That’s Marjorie Taylor Green at the State of the Union looking like she got fired by a Russian airline for wearing too much flair.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Republicans keep coming up with better messaging for Biden than Biden does. He co-opted the Dark Brandon memes and made them a staple of his campaign. Meanwhile, Democrats came up with the slogan—and this is real—’Together we will defeat Donald Trump. Again.’ Here’s how you know a campaign slogan sucks—when it’s two sentences. That’s like if Obama’s was, ‘Yes we can. Can win an election I mean.'

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: They kept demanding that they make the envelope bigger and bigger. First of all, I have to say congratulations to John Cena. Very rarely does an idea literally push the envelope.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: We had John Cena on stage naked and somehow Trump still managed to be the biggest dick of the night.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: He wasn’t getting any attention, he couldn’t stand it, and so then the Adderall McFlurry kicked in.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Toward the end of the broadcast, Donald Trump… wrote, ‘Has there EVER been a WORSE HOST than Jimmy Kimmel at the Oscars? His opening was that of a less than average person trying to too hard to be something which he is not and never can be.’ This was also his wedding toast to his son, Eric.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: I mean, God bless John [Cena]. I could never do something like that. If I did, I’d win the Oscar for Best Short.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Oppenheimer was the big winner, taking home seven awards including Best Picture. While the award for most paused picture went to John Cena.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Airbnb has banned indoor home security cameras, so now if you want to be creepily spied on you’ll have to stay at Motel 6.
